title: 36. Athena and Poseidon
description: How the worship and symbolism of Athena and Poseidon reflected Athenian identity, power, and values.

questions.question: Which qualities did Athena most strongly represent for Athens?
What aspect of Athenian power was Poseidon particularly associated with?
Which building on the Acropolis was primarily dedicated to Athena Parthenos?
Where were Athena and Poseidon both represented on the Parthenon?
What myth was shown on the west pediment of the Parthenon?
options: The contest between Athena and Poseidon

questions.question: Which building was associated with the contest between Athena and Poseidon?
Which features inside the Erechtheion related to Athena and Poseidon?
options: A statue of Athena Parthenos and altar of Zeus
The olive tree and Poseidon’s salt-water spring

questions.question: Which hero was closely linked with Poseidon in Athenian myth?
Poseidon’s connection to Theseus reinforced which aspect of Athenian identity?
Which building outside Athens was dedicated to Poseidon?
Why was the location of the Temple of Poseidon at Souneion significant?
Which festival involved priests of Poseidon alongside Athena and other gods?
What does the Skirophoria suggest about Athena and Poseidon?
Which temple symbolised Athena’s role as goddess of victory?
How does the prominence of Athena and Poseidon across Athens reflect the city’s power?
options: Balance of land and sea power

questions.question: Overall, what does the worship of both Athena and Poseidon demonstrate about Athens?
options: Combination of military intelligence and naval strength
